meanings.sent1: The teacher used a distributive method to share the candies equally among the students.
meanings.sent2: The company's distributive policy ensured fair allocation of resources to all departments.
meanings.sent3: The distributive squirrel carefully divided the nuts among its friends.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as distributive as sunshine, spreading joy to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The distributive rain showered the parched land, bringing relief to the crops.

meanings.sent1: The distributive process was carefully planned to ensure efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The distributive network connected all the warehouses for seamless operations.
meanings.sent3: The distributive dance performance showcased the diversity of cultures.
meanings.sent4: His distributive leadership style brought harmony to the team.
meanings.sent5: The distributive system streamlined the delivery of goods to customers.

meanings.definition: Capable of being distributed or divided among a group
meanings.sent1: The distributive task was easily split among the team members.
meanings.sent2: The distributive workload was manageable due to effective planning.
meanings.sent3: The distributive pizza was shared among friends during the party.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was as distributive as a warm hug on a cold day.
meanings.sent5: The distributive nature of the project allowed for collaboration among different departments.
